item.title: Mergers and acquisitions in the early stages are decelerating in Southeast Asia and Korea
item.description:
Announcements for early-stage mergers and acquisitions (M&A) in Q4 2016 are predicted to be similar to the same period last year. This is attributed to reduced early-stage M&A activity in Southeast Asia and South Korea, as per the latest Intralinks Deal Flow Predictor (DFP) report released by Intralinks Holdings. Intralinks provides software and services, including virtual data rooms (VDRs), for managing M&A transactions. item.title: The average increase in deal values due to M&A deal leaks is US$21 million
item.description:
A new study by Intralinks and Cass Business School revealed that confidential information leaks about mergers and acquisitions (M&A) before an official announcement added an average of US$21 million to the value of disclosed deals in 2016. The report found that 8.6% of global M&A deals experienced leaks in 2016, a figure consistent with 2015 and exceeding the six-year low of 6% observed in 2014.
